flawed_nl_solution:
If Emani has $150, Howard has $150 - $30 = $<<150-30=110>>110
In total, they have $110 + $150 = $<<110+150=260>>260
When they share this money equally, each gets $260 / 2 people = $<<260/2=130>>130/person

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 120, not 110. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
